Package net.xqhs.flash.core.support

Class AbstractMessagingShard

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.config.Config
      • net.xqhs.util.logging.Unit
        • net.xqhs.flash.core.shard.AgentShardCore
          • net.xqhs.flash.core.support.AbstractMessagingShard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ConfigurableEntity<Agent>, Entity<Agent>, AgentShard, MessagingShard, net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractNameBasedMessagingShard
    public abstract class AbstractMessagingShard
extends AgentShardCore
implements MessagingShard
    Prototype class for shards offering messaging functionality, containing some general implementation-independent methods.

    Extending this class

    The abstract class implements some basic methods for working with slash-delimited addresses, and offers the method for registering message handlers. The class also eases the task of posting agent events to the agent thread, by means of the method receiveMessage(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) that should be called by extending classes.

    Basically, a class extending AbstractMessagingShard should implement the following:

    • if the messaging system uses agent names as their addresses, then it is recommended to extend the AbstractNameBasedMessagingShard class.
    • it should implement the sendMessage(String, String, String) method that sends a message to another agent.
    • it should implement the extractAgentAddress(String) which extracts the address of the agent from a complete endpoint.
    • it should implement the getAgentAddress() which retrieves the address of the current agent.
    • when a message is received, the implementation should call the receiveMessage(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) of this class, which will pack the information into an AgentWave and post it in the event queue.
    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Method Detail

      • receiveMessage

        protected void receiveMessage​(java.lang.String source,
                              java.lang.String destination,
                              java.lang.String content)
        Extending classes should call this method to defer to AbstractMessagingShard the effort of packing message data into an AgentEvent and posting that event in the agent event queue.
        Parameters:
        source - - the source of the message, as a complete endpoint
        destination - - the destination of the message, as complete endpoint (must begin with the agent's address).
        content - - the content of the message

      • extractInternalAddress

        public java.lang.String extractInternalAddress​(java.lang.String endpoint)
        The method extracts, from a complete endpoint address, the internal path. It should always begin with a slash.

        The default implementation of the method uses extractAgentAddress(String) to identify the external path in the endpoint. Specific implementations may do this more efficiently.

        Parameters:
        endpoint - - the complete endpoint address.
        Returns:
        the internal part of the endpoint address.

      • extractAgentAddress

        public abstract java.lang.String extractAgentAddress​(java.lang.String endpoint)
        The method extracts, from a complete endpoint address, the external path, which is the address of the agent identified by the endpoint.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - - the complete endpoint address.
        Returns:
        the external path, or address of the agent.

      • getAgentAddress

        public abstract java.lang.String getAgentAddress()
        Specified by:
        getAgentAddress in interface MessagingShard
        Returns:
        the address of this agent in the Pylon this shard is assigned to.

      • sendMessage

        public abstract boolean sendMessage​(java.lang.String source,
                                    java.lang.String target,
                                    java.lang.String content)
        Description copied from interface: MessagingShard
        Sends a message to another agent, according to the specific implementation.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface MessagingShard
        Parameters:
        source - - the source (complete) endpoint of the message.
        target - - the target (complete) endpoint of the message.
        content - - the content of the message.
        Returns:
        true if the message was sent successfully.
